raulcd commented on PR #13548:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13548#issuecomment-1196889511

   I am quite confused about the travis error here. From my understanding on travis we were overriding the default Dockerfile on `ubuntu-20.04-cpp.dockerfile` from: `ARROW_FLIGHT=OFF \` with `-e ARROW_FLIGHT=ON` on `.travis.yml`.
   This change updates the default on the `ubuntu-20.04-cpp.dockerfile` from: `ARROW_FLIGHT=OFF \` to:
   ```
       ARROW_FLIGHT=ON \
       ARROW_FLIGHT_SQL=ON \
   ```
   but having specified on travis:
   `-e ARROW_FLIGHT_SQL=OFF`
   should be exactly the same scenario as initially:
   Flight ON, Flight SQL OFF but I am getting the following error:

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: Currently Dockerfiles for ubuntu 18.04 and 20.04 cpp builds don't have Flight and / or Flight SQL enabled. Should we enable it?
fields.summary: [CI] Enable Flight and Flight SQL on ubuntu cpp 20.04 builds

comments.body: Split in support for ubuntu 20.04 and 18.04
